Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> With or without article, boys weren't businessman. Cryptopia crash was inevitable, they had too many employees for their income. Business model with about 1000 coins and low volume was allways risky. It takes too many support employees for every coin with 0 volume. Crash just happened much sooner than expected and shady way. Hack(s) with internal help? That seems possible/probable from the very begining...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Cruz X (10) HUSH is compatible with all the new atomicdex stuff, tho I am not sure they have enabled all the coins yet. Probably testing on a small subset of coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> @dukeleto I'm more curious about Hush messages and Hush lists.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> What is your take on being able to build a wallet, an app, on Android, where these two features would probably be received very wellm

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Cruz X (10) if you are willing to pair your phone with your laptop/desktop/server, and let it do some stuff, then the tech basically already exists and needs to be glued together. But pure-mobile shielded transactions with memo fields don't currently exist and nobody is working on it. Zcash shielded mobile transactions do not have memo fields

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> which is why I am not much interested in all the latest shielded mobile stuff from Zcash. None of it has memo fields, for privacy reasons. Asking for memo field data to a 3rd party server tells that server which transactions you care about, it's a privacy thing. Light wallets and shielded transactions are very different, and it's amazing you can do light shielded transactions at all

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> I get it. Being able to do light shielded txs is impressive.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> What type of OS/architecture would need to exist, on mobile, to maintain privacy? Does it exist?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <AkiraX> im quite impressed with the conversation going on in the discord lately.  im learning alot

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> It helps when you have experienced and knowledgeable people, that will come in here & talk.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> It's nice to have that option

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> _____
Is it important to be on a lot of exchanges?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Cruz X (10) there are fundamental issues with giving up privacy and using a 3rd party server for shielded transactions. Supporting memo fields tells the server which transactions you are interested in and that ruins stuff, so Zcash decided to just not support the memo field and move forward like that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Cruz X (10) very long github issue describing things here: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/3638

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Light wallet shielded transactions can be thought of as a "Zcash Lite" protocol, because it does not include some very important things in the full Zcash Protocol, most importantly the memo field.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It greatly reduces bandwidth needs too, as every memo field is 512 bytes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> Lol well IMO it's never acceptable to trade off privacy, for convenience.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Cruz X (10)> Even if it's just to satisfy a group of individuals.
Because it becomes easier for you to expose information.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - MineHush.com> `And if I only have wallet.dat?`
run the new gui/daemon with `-zapwallettxes`, the wallet.dat in the proper place for the new chain, and it should right itself

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Seymour if you are on windows, you can use your old wallet.dat with SilentDragon, too: https://github.com/MyHush/SilentDragon/releases

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You will need to start hushd with `-zapwallettxes` manually tho, the GUI doesn't know how to do that yet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and of course, SilentDragon is recommended on Linux/Unix as well, but you need to compile

the way to do it is run hushd manually first
`hushd -zapwallettxes`
then run the GUI

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Seymour you can also use private key method. Simplest thing is to use Verus Agama WIF2WIF tool, convert old private key of HUSH to new style, then import that private key to either HUSHmate or SilentDragon

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Seymour nothing is time-based, so you can wait to any time to do this stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you have hundreds of addresses, that might suck. If you have a handful, it should work fine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> SilentDragon is learning how to convert old private keys to new, that should be in the next release of SD

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <heguli97> Currently it's only the memo field, so you can send short text to others and add in a reply address if you want the recipient to reply to your message.
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/407861562108542988/602242076536471568/Hush-silentdragonzaddrmemo.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> also there's this commit in github which will allow small files to be sent <https://github.com/MyHush/SilentDragon/commit/8c1629a16b02c6475928a201d4cbaf50c4c8f735>

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <AkiraX> Hushlist memoa work.  I sent a private memo.  I believe duke also added upload file functionality. But that has to be built.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh sending of memos back and forth 1-to-1 with replies or anon currently works in SilentDragon. That is "chat". Mailing lists (1-to-many) is not implemented and file upload stuff I have began working on in the `upload` branch. Small files can be uploaded and I am currently working on supporting 200KB file upload, which takes GUI as well as backend changes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> there will be a more stream-lined GUI for chat, that people expect, but the core functionality is there

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh mac binaries will come soon, our windows binaries were kind of a canary in the coal mine, to find various bugs so we can make binaries for more platforms on the next release
